alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; New River Mesa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:44PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila and Maricopa Counties through 230 PM MST... At 143 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Black Canyon City to near Round Valley. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, Round Valley, Sugarloaf Mountain, New River, Sycamore Creek, Sunflower, Cave Creek, Carefree, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek, Rio Verde, Horseshoe Reservoir and Seven Springs. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 233 and 241. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 212 and 214, between mile markers 217 and 218, and between mile markers 221 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; New River Mesa
